With respect to the above grammar, which one of the following choices is correct? 
(A) The actions can be used to type-check syntactically correct integer variable decla- 
rations and integer expressions. 
(B)The actions will lead to an infinite loop. 
(C)The actions can be used to type-check syntactically correct boolean variable decla- 
rations and boolean expressions. 
(D)The actions can be used to correctly type-check any syntactically correct program. 
Ans. 
A
 
Question 36 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
NAT (1M) 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question ID : 823251554 
 
Consider the following representation of a number in IEEE 754 single-precision floating point format 
with bass of 127  
 
S : 1 
 
E : 10000001 
F : 11110000000000000000000 
Here S, E and F denote the sign, exponent and fraction components of the floating 
point representation. 
The decimal value corresponding to the above representation (rounded to 2 decimal 
places) is_______. 
Ans. 
–7.75
